result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon G Erickson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500) [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be collected during term of supervision. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

chargeModifiers.descr: as a Party to a Crime

Defendant Brandon G Erickson in court with attorney Sergio Magana.  Defendant in custody. Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel recently appointed and requests adjournment. Discovery materials just received and needs to prepare for trial and possibly resolve cases. Speedy trial request is withdrawn by defense. State is prepared for trial. Court grants adjournment. Matter will not be placed on jury trial but scheduled for further proceedings.  Further proceedings scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Phone contact made with both the District Attorney's Office and Attorney Magana's office to advise the request for adjournment was denied and that the Jury Status Hearing is still scheduled for 03/05/2015 at 8:30 am. Notices also mailed.
Jury status hearing on March 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brandon G Erickson in court with attorney Robert W. Buckett.  Defendant in custody. Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Buckett believed matter was going to be a disposition today but Mr Erickson is now requesting to have new counsel. Defendant requests new speedy trial demand and new counsel. Prior demand was withdrawn on 12/2/14. March trial date satisfies the speedy trial demand request and remains as scheduled. Atty Buckett will notify the public defender that new counsel be appointed and should be in place and jury date is set. Court allows counsel to withdraw.

State by DA Gerol.  Defendant in custody & appearing by video conferencing from Ozaukee County Jail and by Atty Dejunco.  Counsel states a public defender will be appointed. Counsel waives reading.  Court advises the defendant of the penalties.  Court finds probable cause.  State requesting $2500 signature bond w/conditions.  Counsel requesting status of prelim hrg; waiving timelimits.  Court orders $2500 signature bond w/conditions:  no contact w/Belgium Foundry; no controlled subst/prescrip medic unless prescribed; no contact with co-defendant.  Court orders matter adj to 5/6 at 10 am for status of prelim hrg.
